title: Applying the product rule.
text: Because we are multiplying $$2$$ functions, we need to use the product rule in order to find the derivative. For reference the product rule is $$\frac{d}{\operatorname{dy}\left(f{\left(x\right)} g{\left(x\right)}\right)}=\operatorname{f'}\left(x\right) g{\left(x\right)}+f{\left(x\right)} \operatorname{g'}\left(x\right)$$.

title: Derivative of inverse trigonometric functions:csc(x)
text: The formula for the derivative of inverse csc(x) is (d/dx)csc**(-1)(x)=(-1/(abs(x)*(sqrt((x**2)-1))).
